match.title: 1st ODI
match.statusText: South Africa won by 6 wickets (with 28 balls remaining)

series.name: South Africa tour of New Zealand
series.longName: South Africa tour of New Zealand

image.caption: A general view of Westpac Stadium
image.longCaption: A general view of Westpac Stadium during the third Twenty20 International match between New Zealand and England at Westpac Stadium on February 15, 2013 in Wellington, New Zealand

match.hoursInfo: 14.00 start, First Session 14.00-17.30, Interval 17.30-18.15, Second Session 18.15-21.45

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Brendon McCullum c Peterson b Kallis 56 (67b 2x4 2x6 98m) SR: 83.58

dismissalComment.html: what an outstanding catch at deep point, McCullum had got hold of this length delivery, and had sliced it hard, Peterson did not have much time, he did very well to run to his left and dived to hold on, no reviews needed for that one, Baz has to walk back this time

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kane Williamson c †de Villiers b Tsotsobe 55 (69b 4x4 0x6 114m) SR: 79.71

dismissalComment.html: big strike from Tsotsobe, he got Guptill with a similar delivery earlier, now he has Williamson pushing at an angled length ball outside off, thick edge is snapped up low by a diving AB to his right

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: and there is the breakthrough, they have bowled too well to not have a wicket early, Tsotsobe pitches it up, and angles it across Guptill, who reaches out to push at it, and feathers it through to AB
big strike from Tsotsobe, he got Guptill with a similar delivery earlier, now he has Williamson pushing at an angled length ball outside off, thick edge is snapped up low by a diving AB to his right

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Rob Nicol player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rob Nicol player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Peterson strikes, he has been flighting the ball consistently, lures Nicol into a big shot, he only manages a thick edge that looked to be flying past Kallis at slip, but the great man gets to his right to take it as he tumbles to the ground

headshotImage.caption: Doug Bracewell player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Doug Bracewell player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: fine work from AB down the leg side, Bracewell's back leg is out of his crease as he pushes well forward, and AB has the bails off quickly as the ball slips past Bracewell down leg

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Martin Guptill c †de Villiers b Tsotsobe 7 (17b 1x4 0x6 29m) SR: 41.17

dismissalComment.html: and there is the breakthrough, they have bowled too well to not have a wicket early, Tsotsobe pitches it up, and angles it across Guptill, who reaches out to push at it, and feathers it through to AB

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Jesse Ryder c Smith b Kallis 6 (12b 1x4 0x6 15m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: a big wicket for South Africa, Ryder holes out, a short ball just outside off from Kallis, Ryder wants to club that over the leg side, gets a top edge, the ball soars high and towards Graeme Smith at deep square leg, no mistake there, this was shaping up as a good over for New Zealand, but South Africa won't be complaining now

dismissalText.commentary: James Franklin c Amla b M Morkel 32 (37b 2x4 0x6 52m) SR: 86.48

dismissalComment.html: Franklin falls in pursuit of runs, looks to loft this length delivery over mid off but cannot get it high and far enough to beat Amla who scrambles back to take a well-judged catch

dismissalText.commentary: Andrew Ellis b Steyn 20 (19b 2x4 0x6 26m) SR: 105.26

dismissalComment.html: right through him at 139 kph, and the middle stump is rattled, Ellis looked to use the angle on this length ball to swing it over midwicket, missed, Steyn did not

dismissalComment.html: off stump is knocked back, Nathan looks to swing a pitched up ball on the leg side, does not connect, the ball was right on target

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers not out 106 (106b 3x4 4x6 151m) SR: 100
Faf du Plessis not out 66 (49b 9x4 1x6 72m) SR: 134.69

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: there is the outside edge, and Smith is gone too, Mills slides it full and wide outside off across Smith, who goes chasing after it, and the thick edge is taken at slip

headshotImage.caption: Doug Bracewell player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Doug Bracewell player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Bracewell has taken out Kallis with the short ball, Kallis looked to go behind square leg as he swivelled late for the pull, but was hurried into the shot and ended up lobbing it to square leg

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla b Southee 8 (10b 1x4 0x6 18m) SR: 80

dismissalComment.html: Southee strikes, Amla pushes, from the crease, the ball moves in from back of a length, takes the inside edge and clatters into the stumps

headshotImage.longCaption: Rob Nicol player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy c & b Nicol 46 (74b 2x4 0x6 102m) SR: 62.16

dismissalComment.html: Nicol breaks the stand, Duminy, looking to work a full delivery around leg into the on side, gets a leading edge which Nicol snaps up eagerly and throws the ball in celebration

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: South Africa end the chase with a stroke that has brought them so many runs today, a work square on the leg side

commentPostTextItems.html: That is it from us for this game for the moment. Read Andrew Fernando's match report here. This is Abhishek Purohit signing off. Cheers

AB de Villiers is the Man of the Match. AB: "We did really well in the field to restrict them. They had a couple of partnerships, but we kept getting wickets, and that is where we won the game. It was a slowish kind of wicket, and it is important to build pressure on these kind of wickets. JP felt a bit of pressure early on, he did not hit it as well as he would have liked, but he played an important knock. Faf did extremely well. I thought I constructed my innings well which was difficult on this pitch and in these conditions."

Brendon McCullum: "We thought 250 was competitive, but we would have had to bowl exceptionally well. In hindsight, we needed someone to get a big hundred, like AB did for them. No regrets in batting first though. We were looking to take that batting Powerplay a bit early, but we kept losing wickets. You cannot allow world-class players to get into the game, and we allowed AB to do that."

They just did not have enough runs on the board, New Zealand, with the kind of batting line-up South Africa have. AB de Villiers was always in control and New Zealand could never stop the boundaries from coming when they needed to. Faf du Plessis will never forget what happened in Dhaka that evening in March 2011, but this innings will give him a lot of confidence, especially the way he finished the game with a burst of big strokes.
MrGarreth: "9 of AB's 13 100s have come since 2010 at an average of 77.75. Dont get much better than that!"

commentTextItems.html: slants it too far across the batsman
he walks across and outside off stump looking to steer the quick and flat one but pushes it towards short third man
he tries to finish it by making room down the leg side and eyeing extra cover, but Southee gets it around the blockhole, and he mistimes the stroke

headshotImage.caption: Doug Bracewell player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Doug Bracewell player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: another low full toss on the pads taken for a couple through square leg, boundary saved with a slide
slower bouncer gone completely wrong, down the leg side
smashes the drive off the full delivery to extra cover
South Africa almost through now, AB withdraws towards the leg side, Southee drops it short, AB has a flail, and collects four with a thick edge to the fine third man boundary
hits a pitched up delivery towards mid on for one
four more, New Zealand continue to pay for their leg-stump line, Southee goes full down the pads in search of the yorker, and a fine tickle is all that is needed
driven stylishly straight to mid on

headshotImage.caption: Doug Bracewell player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Doug Bracewell player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: inside edge dribbles square on the leg side off a full delivery
it's all come apart for New Zealand, Faf rubs it in with a controlled pull to a short ball, takes his third boundary in three balls, this time through midwicket
he is not going to let a repeat of Dhaka happen, scurries down the pitch once again, this time he goes straight down the ground, another boundary
now Faf goes to 50 in typical fashion, with a charge to the fast bowler, and clobbers the shortish ball over midwicket

commentPreTextItems.html: Dan: "On a pitch where everyone else seems to have struggled, this has been a magnificent innings from AB. This game is now looking as easy to close out as Wednesday's was for the Caps. Unusual dismissal, unusual dismissal, anything for an unusual dismissal!"

commentTextItems.html: captain AB gets to a superb century under pressure when his team needed it, with a work on the leg side, acknowledges the applause with a no-fuss nod and a raise of the bat
Southee drops it short this time, into Faf with the angle, who finds nothing with his attempted hook

headshotImage.caption: Doug Bracewell player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Doug Bracewell player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: he tried to follow the batsman who was making room down the leg side but ended up sending it futher wide of Faf, more extras, they have been held back long enough
in the blockhole, but AB moves on to 99 with a nudge on the leg side
first extras of the innings as this delivery scoots towards the keeper off the pads

headshotImage.longCaption: Rob Nicol player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Rob Nicol player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rob Nicol player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Rob Nicol c Kallis b Peterson 30 (58b 4x4 0x6 68m) SR: 51.72

dismissalComment.html: Peterson strikes, he has been flighting the ball consistently, lures Nicol into a big shot, he only manages a thick edge that looked to be flying past Kallis at slip, but the great man gets to his right to take it as he tumbles to the ground

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Brendon McCullum c Peterson b Kallis 56 (67b 2x4 2x6 98m) SR: 83.58

dismissalComment.html: what an outstanding catch at deep point, McCullum had got hold of this length delivery, and had sliced it hard, Peterson did not have much time, he did very well to run to his left and dived to hold on, no reviews needed for that one, Baz has to walk back this time

headshotImage.caption: Jesse Ryder player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jesse Ryder player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Jesse Ryder player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jesse Ryder player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Jesse Ryder c Smith b Kallis 6 (12b 1x4 0x6 15m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: a big wicket for South Africa, Ryder holes out, a short ball just outside off from Kallis, Ryder wants to club that over the leg side, gets a top edge, the ball soars high and towards Graeme Smith at deep square leg, no mistake there, this was shaping up as a good over for New Zealand, but South Africa won't be complaining now

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kane Williamson c †de Villiers b Tsotsobe 55 (69b 4x4 0x6 114m) SR: 79.71

dismissalComment.html: big strike from Tsotsobe, he got Guptill with a similar delivery earlier, now he has Williamson pushing at an angled length ball outside off, thick edge is snapped up low by a diving AB to his right

headshotImage.caption: James Franklin player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: James Franklin player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: James Franklin player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: James Franklin player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: James Franklin c Amla b M Morkel 32 (37b 2x4 0x6 52m) SR: 86.48

dismissalComment.html: Franklin falls in pursuit of runs, looks to loft this length delivery over mid off but cannot get it high and far enough to beat Amla who scrambles back to take a well-judged catch

headshotImage.caption: Andrew Ellis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Andrew Ellis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Andrew Ellis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Andrew Ellis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Andrew Ellis b Steyn 20 (19b 2x4 0x6 26m) SR: 105.26

dismissalComment.html: right through him at 139 kph, and the middle stump is rattled, Ellis looked to use the angle on this length ball to swing it over midwicket, missed, Steyn did not

headshotImage.caption: Doug Bracewell player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Doug Bracewell player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Doug Bracewell player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Doug Bracewell player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Doug Bracewell st †de Villiers b Peterson 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: fine work from AB down the leg side, Bracewell's back leg is out of his crease as he pushes well forward, and AB has the bails off quickly as the ball slips past Bracewell down leg

dismissalText.commentary: Nathan McCullum b M Morkel 15 (15b 0x4 1x6 25m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: off stump is knocked back, Nathan looks to swing a pitched up ball on the leg side, does not connect, the ball was right on target

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla b Southee 8 (10b 1x4 0x6 18m) SR: 80

dismissalComment.html: Southee strikes, Amla pushes, from the crease, the ball moves in from back of a length, takes the inside edge and clatters into the stumps

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Jesse Ryder player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jesse Ryder player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Graeme Smith c Ryder b Mills 9 (16b 1x4 0x6 21m) SR: 56.25

dismissalComment.html: there is the outside edge, and Smith is gone too, Mills slides it full and wide outside off across Smith, who goes chasing after it, and the thick edge is taken at slip

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Doug Bracewell player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Doug Bracewell player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Jacques Kallis c Williamson b Bracewell 13 (17b 2x4 0x6 26m) SR: 76.47

dismissalComment.html: Bracewell has taken out Kallis with the short ball, Kallis looked to go behind square leg as he swivelled late for the pull, but was hurried into the shot and ended up lobbing it to square leg

headshotImage.caption: Rob Nicol player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rob Nicol player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Rob Nicol player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rob Nicol player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy c & b Nicol 46 (74b 2x4 0x6 102m) SR: 62.16

dismissalComment.html: Nicol breaks the stand, Duminy, looking to work a full delivery around leg into the on side, gets a leading edge which Nicol snaps up eagerly and throws the ball in celebration

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers not out 106 (106b 3x4 4x6 151m) SR: 100
Faf du Plessis not out 66 (49b 9x4 1x6 72m) SR: 134.69

New Zealand: 100 runs in 24.4 overs (149 balls), Extras 13

BB McCullum: 50 off 62 balls (2 x 4, 2 x 6)
Drinks: New Zealand - 137/3 in 30.0 overs (KS Williamson 29)
New Zealand: 150 runs in 32.3 overs (197 balls), Extras 17
Powerplay 3: Overs 35.1 - 40.0 (Batting side - 32 runs, 0 wicket)
KS Williamson: 50 off 59 balls (4 x 4)
New Zealand: 200 runs in 42.1 overs (256 balls), Extras 18
New Zealand: 250 runs in 49.6 overs (303 balls), Extras 24
Innings Break: New Zealand - 253/9 in 50.0 overs (KD Mills 4, TG Southee 4)
South Africa innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 36 runs, 3 wickets)

Drinks: South Africa - 61/3 in 16.0 overs (JP Duminy 11, AB de Villiers 20)
4th Wicket: 50 runs in 73 balls (JP Duminy 18, AB de Villiers 34, Ex 0)
South Africa: 100 runs in 24.5 overs (149 balls), Extras 0
AB de Villiers: 50 off 65 balls (1 x 4, 1 x 6)

South Africa: 150 runs in 33.5 overs (203 balls), Extras 0

Powerplay 3: Overs 35.1 - 40.0 (Batting side - 45 runs, 0 wicket)
5th Wicket: 50 runs in 41 balls (AB de Villiers 20, F du Plessis 30, Ex 0)
South Africa: 200 runs in 39.5 overs (239 balls), Extras 0
AB de Villiers: 100 off 101 balls (2 x 4, 4 x 6)
5th Wicket: 100 runs in 78 balls (AB de Villiers 51, F du Plessis 45, Ex 4)
F du Plessis: 50 off 42 balls (6 x 4, 1 x 6)
South Africa: 250 runs in 44.4 overs (268 balls), Extras 5

stories.title: de Villiers shows New Zealand the way
stories.subTitle: South Africa in New Zealand 2011-12
stories.seoTitle: South Africa in New Zealand 2011-12: de Villiers shows New Zealand the way
stories.summary: While brazen aggression might have intimidated Zimbabwe in the previous series, Brendon McCullum must remember that smarts and mettle are required to topple a side of South Africa's pedigree

stories.title: South Africa cruise to win after de Villiers ton
stories.subTitle: New Zealand v South Africa, 1st ODI, Wellington
stories.seoTitle: New Zealand v South Africa, 1st ODI: South Africa cruise to win after de Villiers ton
stories.summary: A masterful run-a-ball 106 not out from AB de Villers shepherded an expert South Africa chase, as they hauled in New Zealand's 253 for 9 with six wickets and 4.4 overs to spare in Wellington
